name: Specially Adapted Housing for Disabled Veterans
objective: To help certain severely disabled veterans acquire a home which is suitably adapted to meet the special needs of their disabilities.
beneficiary_types: Physically Afflicted (e.g. TB, Arthritis, Heart Disease)
applicant_types: Specialized group (e.g. health professionals, students, veterans)

results.description: FY 2016 grants were made to 2,037 disabled Veterans
In 2017 grants were made to 2,389 disabled Veterans
Estimated grants made to disabled Veterans in 2018 is 2,389
In FY 19, 2,795 disabled Veterans received grants.  (FY 20 est.: 3,064 Veterans; FY 21 est.: 3,127 Veterans)

The Specially Adapted Housing Grant Program continues to grow with another banner year of production. Providing the recipients with a barrier-free living environment and an increased quality of life. Nearly 53 thousand grants awarded since January 1948, totaling nearly 2.62 billion dollars.

authorizations.text: Veterans' Housing Opportunity and Benefits Improvement Act of 2006. Pub. L. 109, 233. 38 U.S.C. § 2101-2106.

rules_regulations: 38 CFR 3.809, 36.4400-36.4411 , and title 38, United State Code, chapter 21; "Handbook for Design:  A Guide for Specially Adapted Housing and Special Housing Adaptation Projects," VA Pamphlet 26-13, can be viewed and downloaded at: https://benefits.va.gov/WARMS/docs/admin26/m26_13/sah-2022-update-26-13.pdf; "Federal Benefits for Veterans and Dependents," VA Pamphlet 80-0-01, $5.00 , available from Superintendent of Documents, P.O.
